iaik.security.random

Class JDKSeedGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • iaik.security.random.SeedGenerator
      • iaik.security.random.VarLengthSeedGenerator
        • iaik.security.random.JDKSeedGenerator

  • public class JDKSeedGenerator
extends VarLengthSeedGenerator
    This class is a simple wrapper for the seed generator used in JDK SecureRandom. If required, the SecureRandom that is used to obtain the seed can also be set manually, via JDKSeedGenerator.setSecureRandom(SecureRandom). This is recommended, if the SecureRandom selected by default does not generate a secure seed. It can generate as many bytes as you need, but it is fairly slow. That process is started when you call getSeed(). Per default this class generates a 256 bit seed (32 bytes).
    Version:
    File Revision 18

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public int[] getStatus()
        Return the status of seed generation. This is always {numBits, numBits}, i.e. it is always ok to call getSeed().
        Specified by:
        getStatus in class SeedGenerator

      • getSeed

        public byte[] getSeed()
        Return the seed. It takes about 1/3 of a second per byte until this method returns (when called for the first time, later it will return the same seed again instantly).
        Specified by:
        getSeed in class SeedGenerator

      • setSecureRandom

        public static void setSecureRandom(java.security.SecureRandom random)
        Sets the SecureRandom instance to be used by all JDKSeedGenerator instances.
        Parameters:

      • getSecureRandom

        public static java.security.SecureRandom getSecureRandom()
        Returns the SecureRandom instance that is in use by all JDKSeedGenerator instances.
        Returns:
        a SecureRandom instance
